name: Vitamin K2 (MK-7)
description: Fat-soluble vitamin essential for calcium metabolism — directs calcium to bones and teeth while preventing arterial calcification. MK-7 form (from natto) has longest half-life and best clinical evidence. Critical companion to vitamin D3 supplementation.
mechanisms: Matrix GLA protein activation (prevents arterial calcification)

dosage.notes: Always pair with vitamin D3. MK-7 form preferred (longer half-life than MK-4). Fat-soluble — take with meals. Essential if supplementing high-dose D3.

keyFindings: Reduced arterial stiffness in postmenopausal women (3-year RCT)
MK-7 supplementation improved bone density and reduced fractures
Rotterdam Study: highest K2 intake associated with 50% less arterial calcification
